summary:
- Kansas City Southern (KCS) reported revenues of $2,947.3m for Q4 2021, an increase of 12% YoY, driven by growth across all segments.
- Carloads and units increased by 7% and 4%, respectively, with growth in all commodity groups.
- Operating income was $883.8m, an increase of 10% YoY, driven by higher revenues and lower operating expenses, partially offset by higher fuel prices and the impact of inflation.
- Net income attributable to KCS was $527m, an increase of 14% YoY, driven by higher operating income and lower income tax expense, partially offset by higher interest expense and the impact of inflation.
- KCS ended the quarter with $339.3m in cash and cash equivalents, a decrease of $188.2m YoY.
- The company had $7,843.6m in long-term debt and short-term borrowings, a decrease of $157.3m YoY.
- KCS announced a new share repurchase program of up to $1bn through December 31, 2023.
